Post-Match Reflections: Jimmy Butler commented that he doesn't have any joy playing for the Heat anymore and probably won't reconcile with the team.
Heat star Jimmy Butler scored just nine points with two rebounds, four assists and two steals in 27 minutes in Miami's 13-point loss to the Pacers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Heat president Pat Riley releasing a statement that they won't trade the six-time All-Star Jimmy Butler.
The team isn't playing well, and Butler hasn't been wholly impactful on both ends for most of the season.
Others: Heat forward Jimmy Butler posted back-to-back nine-point performances this week.
Butler is averaging 17.6 points, 5.5 rebounds, 4.7 assists and 1.2 steals per game on 55.2 percent shooting–a career-best–and 37.5 percent from 3-point range on low volume.
